page.title: 03DRUMNADROCHIT'S WILDLIFE
page.content: There is much{deciduous woodland}, mainly birch,oak and alder in the area,which are rich in animal life with roe deer and pine martens and many birds including tawny owls, buzzards,tits,chaffinchs,thrushes and summer visitors like wood and willow warblers and spotted and pied flycatchers.Autumn sees huge numbers of redwings coming to feast on rowan berries.In the new{conifer {plantations}foxes and roe deer are common and the birds include siskins, crossbill & sparrow hawks.{Balmacaan {Wood}has recently been bought by the {Woodland Trust}as a nature reserve. The fast flowing{rivers}have trout and salmon in them and dippers,herons, wagtails and goosanders are all common. On{farmland}yellow hammers and whinchats breed and in winter there are alot of finches and gulls.
